oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The Comparative Effectiveness of Carbicarb-R, Tribonate-R and Bicarbonate in the Treatment of Acidosis in Neonatal Calves
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Berchtold, J.
Hartmann, H.
Hofmann, W.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: mixed respiratory-metabolic acidosis
primary respiratory-metabolic acidosis
alkalinizing agents
acidosis
sodium-bicarbonate
Carbicarb-R
Tribonate-R
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The objective of this study was to compare the bufferingeffects of sodium-bicarbonate (NaHCO3), Carbicarb-R (equimolar sodium-bicarbonate and sodium-carbonate [Na2CO3]) and Tribonate-R (Tris buffer mixture) during i.v. treatment of acidosis in neonatal calves. Most alkalinizing agents such as bicarbonate, lactate or acetate are only effective after increased pulmonary elimination of CO2 produced in buffer reactions. These substances are not suitable and are even contraindicated in the therapy of primary respiratory or mixed respiratory-metabolic acidosis.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1997; 135
